channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Several cracked pavement slabs outside 29 Bedwell house residential flats SW9 6AG Brixton road., 8th February
item.description:
I like to report several cracked pavement slabs outside number 29 Bedwell house residential flats on Brixton Road SW9. The cracked slabs have raised ends which could possibly prove fatal if someone has a mis-step over them. Please could they be repaired at your earliest convenience. It seems a heavy truck or dustbin lorry may have drove onto it thus causing the substantial damage. The pavements has been like this for over two months.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): George Mews, Brixton, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Human excrement on pavement for last 10 days, 8th February
item.description:
There is a pile of what looks like human excrement on the pavement outside nos. 23 and 25. It’s been there for over a week. It has been stepped in several times and spread all over the pavement, so it’s now difficult to avoid without walking on the road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, De Crespigny Park, Camberwell, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 50cm out Beresford House, 8th February
item.description:
The potholes cannot be avoided when driving out of Bradford residential parking and is had to see.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Bowen Drive, Dulwich, Greater London

item.title: Muddy slippery pavement. Note this is the only pavement on this busy road leading to primary school and church, 8th February
item.description:
This dangerous pavement is mucky and slippy and has been reported many times over several months and Enfield Council has done nothing to repair it knowing it is the only oavement that parents and children can use to get to their school and for parishioners young and onld to reach their church.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Waterfall Road, Southgate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left on pavement by builder since 2nd feb, 8th February
item.description:
Builder's rubbish on pavement and concrete blocks left in road since 2nd feb. Accident risk and flytipping reducing walkway for disabled and buggies.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 36, Kinsale Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This van has at least one flat tyre and is causing a blind spot when travelling from Alabama Street left into Flaxton Road, 8th February
item.description:
It is on the 291 bus route and could cause an accident - as you can’t see vehicles coming round the corner. It has been there at least a few months - before December 2025.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Alabama Street, Plumstead
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Unsightly Litter opposite entrance to Kelsey Park, 8th February
item.description:
Location: Area fenced off with temporary railings immediately to the left of the entrance to Kelsey Park. Litter has accumulated within and around these railings and is very unsightly - please can you attend and clear all the litter. I’m sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. Tap to see exactly where it is: ///yoga.ocean.oasis Https://w3w.co/yoga.ocean.oasis
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 92, Wickham Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned on vanbrugh park estate, 8th February
item.description:
This car has been abandoned on vanbrugh park estate for months and has multiple parking violations piled on the windshield. it’s taking up a residents’ parking space, which is highly inconvenient as we have a small child and can’t park near our home. please come to tow this car away.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Combe Avenue, Blackheath
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Many reports: still not done, 8th February
item.description:
Reported 8 times: Ref. 8740964, 8767348, 8776480, 8785014, 8794204, 8850216, 8859797 This is the 9th time been reported to you ! Please send the estate cleaner to remove this build up of urine stains! Homeless people use this very spot as their toilet! This very place needs to be scrubbed and disinfected with the strong chemicals and mopped daily! The next step it will be escalating this matter to the Housing Officer and Complain Department

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glengall Road, Peckham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Water leaks, 8th February
item.description:
There are bad water leaks from the edge of the first two properties on Mottingham Road. They have been like this for weeks now, not only wasting water but presenting a hazard as when it's cold, the water freezes making this part of the pavement unusable as it's on a slope too.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mottingham Road, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Bannockburn Road, Plumstead

item.title: Sorn vehicle abandoned, 8th February
item.description:
This car does not belong to any residents of Cedar Mount. It has been here a week and is full of belongings that is tempting for burglars and puts all our vehicles and properties at greater risk. This is not private land so is not legally suitable for a car registered as SORN with no current MOT either. It is hogging a car park space that is only for use by residents.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cedar Mount, Mottingham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
